lines.text: You live in a free society; you have no choice.
it's unselfish love, grown up love. You know it is. It's mature, absolute, thrilling love.
Yes, because I prefer Russia. It's as corrupt as America, but there's less bullshit.
How the fuck do you peddle an arms race when the only asshole you've got to race against is yourself?
Have you ever met any jazz musicians you would describe, or who would describe themselves, as anarchists?
Hmmm... ah, there was a trombone player, Wilfred Baker.
[the interrogator starts writing]
He's the only jazz musician I can think of who is completely devoid of anarchist tendencies.
Any decent church would have burned you bastards years ago.
You have to think like a hero merely to behave like a decent human being.
[talking about Western relations with Russia]
Aren't we supposed to be such good friends now?

[sarcastically]
Oh, my dear lord...

Because this year it suits them to roll over on their backs and play nice doggie? Because this year they're on the floor anyway? You ninny! All the more reason to spy the living daylights out of them. Kick them in the balls every time they get to their knees.

[on the phone with Ned]
I've heard the tapes and I've never so much pussy-footing around in my life! Barley needs to tell Katya, 'No more Greta fucking Garbo!' And Dante better shit or get off the pot! We're being pelted with crap on the streets over here!
Alright, Russell, message understood.
[Hangs up and calls someone over]
Russell's metaphors are becoming rather scatological.
[while training for a covert mission]
This is fun... Is that why you keep it secret?
Glasnost gives everyone the right to complain and accuse, but it doesn't make shoes.
I am an honest-to-God glasnostic. My parents were glasnostics from way back. My children will be raised glasnostic, even though I don't have any children.
Wasn't Ray the sweetest man you ever met?
Ray was a prince.
Ever play chess with him?
As a matter of fact I did.
Who won?
I did.
So did I.
This is just like school! Dear old, bloody old, school!

[to Ned]
Dante is going to phone Katya at the hospital. If he does that, will you shut the fuck up? Or stay out of my operation?
to save your precious secrets or to trade them for Katya and her family. The easiest decision I ever made.

[looking around the mess of Barley's apartment]
How do you *live* with yourself?
Actually I don't live with myself. I tend to give myself a pretty wide berth.
If there is to be a hope we must all betray our country, we have to save each other because all victims are equal and none is more equal than others. It's everyone's duty to start the avalanche.
I'm not the man you thought I was.
You do not have to remind me that man is not equal to his rhetoric.
Mr. Blair, we are buying a Picasso, ok? You don't mind an occasional metaphor now and then, do you?
Not at all.
did Picasso paint it? And you're the man who is selling it to us?
It is not my Picasso, Russell, it is not my Picasso. And I'm not saying it is a Picasso. And, furthermore, I'm not selling it to you. And, lastly, I don't give a fuck whether you buy it or not.
[Russell produces a stack of reports on the analysis of Dante's material]
And is there a conclusion?
drop it down the toilet.
And is that what you think, Russell?

Well, expert opinion has that this notebook was written very quickly... or very slowly. By a man, or a woman. The writer was right-handed, or he was left-handed. What I think? For "experts," there's no toilet deep enough.

You are very gray today, Barley. My father was sent to prison by gray men. He was murdered by men who wore gray uniforms. Gray men ruined my beautiful profession and take care or they will ruin you too.
Who are you, Dante? What do you do for a living?
I am a moral outcast.
Well it's always nice to meet a writer.

they're watching us, your side and my side. We're going to beat them both. I can't save Yakov, nothing can; but you're safe, the children are safe, uncle Matvey's safe. I love you and I won't let you down.
real people for unreal arguments.
You have bewitched my family. My children think all you British are Santa Claus in beautiful tweed clothes.
There's no Santa Claus. Nobody is what it seems. Except you.
Reconstruction! Openness! You don't reconstruct the balance of terror and open the ultimate can of worms.
we trust the motive, we trust the man, and we can trust the material. Why did Dante pick on Katya? Why does he put her life at risk? Why does she let him? Is she a spy?

The trouble is, a lot of very favorite sons are in danger of having their rice bowls broken, all on account of these goddamn notebooks. The Soviet military effort is stalled, the American military effort is stalled. These notebooks say their rocket motors suck instead of blow, they can't do solid fuel for shit...
Do you believe this nonsense?
"What a great country!" That's why I love them... and they're very fond of me.
